topic.title: Add Module - An Introduction
topic.shortdesc: Provides administrative control of role permissions for adding modules to tabs.

body.p: Welcome to the "Add Module" help file. The "Add Module" was built to allow administrators to easily select roles that could add modules at the tab level This allows you to:

ul.li: Give other roles permission to add modules for a particular tab or all tabs (by selecting the show on all tabs tickbox ->Properties->Edit Base Settings)
Assign roles that will have default add, edit, delete, properties permissions on all modules added via this module.

Restrict available modules (All powerful modules are now called Admin - Module Name and are marked as an admin module). Any role that has edit properties permission for the "Add Module" will be able to see admin modules so I recommend only adding admins and maybe 1 other power role (e.g. Site Administrators).

Set View permissions for added modules. You can select the following default view permissions: "All Users", "Authenticated Users", "UnAuthenticated Users" and "Authorised Roles" (Authorised Roles will add all roles that have View permission for the "Add Module" module).
Find out more about each module via the new help system.
Provide a name for your module.
